name: George Harrison Quiz | George Harrison | 15 Questions

questions.text: George Harrison first met which other Beatle as a student of Liverpool Institute?
questions.explanation:
Paul McCartney.

	George attended primary school at Dovedale Primary before becoming a student at the Liverpool Institute in 1954, where he met Paul.

questions.text: In 1958 George became a member of which music group, which already included John Lennon and Paul McCartney?
questions.explanation:
The Quarrymen.

	George had already participated in some performances with the Rebels previous to his joining the Quarrymen, which already included his friend Paul, in 1958. At this point, Ringo Starr had not become the drummer for the group. He would replace Pete Best in that position by 1962.

questions.text: George met the woman who soon would become his first wife in 1964. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Pattie Boyd.

	He married Patti Boyd in 1966 and divorced her in 1977. Eric Clapton, one of George's best friends, wrote a tribute song to Patti Boyd which became a mega-hit, namely 'Layla'. Clapton married Patti Boyd a couple years after her divorce with George. George re-married too...with Olivia Arias, whom he stayed with until his death.

questions.text: George earned what nickname due to his frequent unsmiling demeanor?

George Harrison became infatuated with Indian culture in the late 1960s. Ravi Shankar became a spiritual and musical guide to George during this period. What instrument did Ravi train George on at this time?
questions.explanation:
Sitar.

	The Sitar is a stringed instrument with a very distinctive sound. George helped popularize the instrument in the west. George also later wrote an introduction to a biography of Ravi Shankar.

questions.text: George Harrison was the first Beatle to appear in a movie without the other three, true or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually, this honor belonged to John Lennon who appeared in Richard Lester's comedy 'How I Won the War' in 1967. George was not much for appearing in films, but he was surely involved in the film industry as later questions in this quiz will attest!

questions.text: George was the first Beatle to compose and produce his own solo album.
questions.explanation:
True.

	George composed and produced the soundtrack to the film 'Wonderwall' in 1968. It was also the first album to be produced on the Beatles' own Apple label.

questions.text: Which of the following Beatles' songs was written and performed by George?
questions.explanation:
Something.

	'Something' was the only George Harrison song to grace the A side of a Beatles single. Ironically, Frank Sinatra, who had once testified in Congress to ban rock and roll, called this song one of the most beautiful love songs ever written.

questions.text: In 1971, well after the break-up of the Beatles, George organized a very successful concert in New York City for what country?
questions.explanation:
Bangladesh.

	Two concerts were held to help victims of war and hunger in Bangladesh, and included performers such as Eric Clapton, Ravi Shankar and George himself. The concerts raised a total of 15 million dollars, but much to George's chagrin the money was held in escrow and no one really knows how much of it actually reached the people of Bangladesh.

questions.text: What was the title of George's first post-Beatle album?
questions.explanation:
All Things Must Pass.

	This was also his most successful solo album, going multi-platinum.

questions.text: George started a new career in 1978 as a film producer. What was the name of his production company?
Which of these films was not produced by George's film production company?
questions.explanation:
Private Benjamin.

	'The Life of Brian' was the first film produced by HandMade Films, in 1978. George worked as friend and fan to the Monty Python crew in developing this fine film.

questions.text: In 1988, the ever-creative George created a new band called The Travelling Wilburys. Which of the following performers was not a member of this excellent collaboration?
questions.explanation:
Eric Clapton.

	The Travelling Wilburys included Harrison, Orbison, Dylan, Petty and Jeff Lynne of ELO. 'The Traveling Wilburys, Vol. 1' was their most successful project, going multi-platinum and winning a Grammy Award for Best Rock Performance.

questions.text: What was the title of George Harrison's autobiography?
In 1999, what very strange thing happened to George?
questions.correct: A crazed person broke into his mansion and stabbed him several times
options: Involved in a plane crash but lived
His boat capsized and he was stranded on an island for a month
Lost his memory and wandered in a fugue for several weeks
questions.explanation:
A crazed person broke into his mansion and stabbed him several times.

	Shockingly, he was stabbed several times in his Oxfordshire mansion but survived, thus becoming the second Beatle to suffer an attempt on his life (The obvious first one being John Lennon).
